site_name: East Side Of Cowley Road & Morris House
description: Demolition of existing single storey warehouse units and retail store on east side of Cowley Road and construction of new 4/5 storey building comprising a relocated Somerfield Store fronting The Vale and 9 Class B1 office units at ground and mezzanine floors and 129 live work units on the first to fourth floors.  Refurbishment of Morris House, Swainson Road comprising 9 Class B1 office units at ground and mezzanine floors and 34 live/work units above. On-site parking, servicing and landscaping is proposed (Outline)
decision_conditions: Plans and particulars of the reserved matters for each part of the development referred to in condition 1 above, relating to the design, external appearance and landscaping of any building to be erected and the landscaping of the site, shall be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority and shall be carried out as approved.   REASON: To ensure that no part of the development commences until reserved matters are approved. This condition reflects the provisions of Section 92 of the Town and Country Planning Act and Article 4 of the Town and Country (General Development Procedure) Order 1995. | Approval of the details of the design, external appearance and landscaping, including surfacing (called "the reserved matters") shall be obtained from the Local Planning Authority in writing before any development is commenced.   REASON: The application is in outline form only and is not accompanied by full detailed plans. | Application for the approval of all the reserved matters shall be made to the Local Planning Authority before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.   REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | The development permitted shall be begun either before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission or before the expiration of two years from the date of approval of the last of the reserved matters to be approved, whichever is the later.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Notwithstanding the information contained in this application, nothing in this permission shall convey approval for the design, external appearance and landscaping shown in this application, and such details shall be submitted in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval and shall be carried out as approved.   REASON: So as not to fetter the Council's consideration of the detailed drawings. | Prior to the commencement of development hereby approve, the following detailed drawings shall be submitted for approval to the Local Planning Authority and no development shall take place unless and until such details have been approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details to be submitted for approval shall incorporate the following:  (i) Full plans, elevations and sections where appropriate of all buildings, screen walls, plant and/or machinery, structures and openings on external elevations to scale of not less than 1:100, incorporating details of all materials to be used for external surfaces including samples of all such materials;   (ii) Full details showing the positions, height, design materials and type of boundary treatment between Cowley Road and the adjoining Warehouse at 27 The Vale;   (iii) Full details of proposed live/work units at a scale of not less than 1:50;  (iv) Full details of the proposed external terraces at a scale of not less than 1:50;  (v) Full details of how sufficient light will reach habitable rooms of all live/work units, particularly north facing units at first floor in Block B and all north facing units in Block A.   (vi) Details of external lighting;   (vii) Full details of acoustic treatment measures to all buildings through the submission of a full PPG24 noise and air quality survey, details of which to be agreed by the Local Planning Authority;   (viii) Details of storage and collection of refuse, including full drawings at a scale of not less than 1:50;  (ix) Details of cycle stands and shelters, including full drawings at a scale of not less than 1:50;   Any development shall be carried out and retained in accordance with the details approved by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: In order to ensure that development achieves a quality external appearance and internal layout and is environmentally sound and compatible with surrounding development/land uses in accordance with adopted UDP policies B1, B5, H26 and deposit policies 4.1 and 5.5. | The access, pedestrian footways, parking, servicing and loading arrangements hereby approved, shall be carried out before the development is occupied or brought into use. Thereafter they shall be retained for such purpose and any changes to this layout will require the prior approval in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure that adequate access arrangements exist to serve the development in accordance with adopted UDP policies T63 and deposit policies 9.11. | The turning/loading/unloading facilities approved in respect of the development, shall accord with the current standards of the Local Planning Authority and shall be carried out before the development is occupied or brought into use. Thereafter they shall be retained for such purpose.   REASON: To ensure that adequate facilities are provided and retained to service the development without creating conditions prejudicial to the free flow and safety of traffic on the adjacent highway network adopted UDP B1 and deposit policy 4.4. | The details of the acoustic treatment and means of ventilation to buildings, in compliance with condition 6 (vii) shall be carried out before the buildings are occupied or brought into use, and thereafter retained.   REASON: To protect the occupiers from noise and pollution in accordance with adopted UDP policies B8, B9 and ES5 and deposit UDP policies 2.6 and 4.11. | All surfacing and landscaping approved in respect of the reserved matters shall be provided before the development is occupied or brought into use, or in accordance with a programme agreed with the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.   REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and assist in mitigating air pollution and in accordance with adopted UDP policies B16 and ES4 and deposit policy 4.5. | The refuse storage facilities approved in respect of the development, in compliance with condition 6, shall be installed before the development is occupied or brought into use.   REASON: To ensure that adequate facilities for the storage and collection of refuse/waste are provided in a manner, which does not detract from the amenities of the neighbourhood in accordance with adopted UDP policies H34 and deposit policy 5.5. | A construction strategy shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to commencement of any development hereby approved and thereafter implemented as approved. Such strategy shall address the following matters:-  Limiting hours of noise nuisance. Keeping nearby access free from obstruction and segregating construction and general traffic.  No burning of waste on site. The suppression of dust. The location of means of enclosure of sites for the storage of plant, materials and construction staff accommodation.  Means of securely enclosing construction sites.  Any temporary traffic control measures.  Temporary and permanent access to works. Roads to be used by construction traffic and safeguards to prevent or limit damage.  The display of site notices informing residents of likely disruption including information on, and operating of, a complaints system.  Continuity of existing services. Protection of the general public from health hazards. Location and management of crushing, grinding and cutting operations. Avoidance of blasting.  Public highway cleansing. Sheeting of lorries during transportation of materials. Controls to limit noise and vibration.  Details should be submitted to demonstrate recommendations for lighting of adverts and external lighting etc. will meet required standards.  Treatment of any asbestos in accordance with BS 6187 and Health and Safety Executive Guidance Notices G8/29/1,3,4&5 and other relevant statutory requirements and regulations.  Transportation and tipping in accordance with section 17 of the Control of Pollution Act and the Transport of Hazardous Waste Regulations.   REASON: To ensure that any loss to residential amenity and general disruption are minimised during construction process related to the total development hereby approved in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5 and B9 and deposit policy 4.11. | No more than 129 live/work units shall be provided within the development in Block A and no more than 34 live/work units shall be provided within the development in Block B; ultimately the ability to achieve this level of provision will be considered at the reserved matters stage.   REASON: To ensure that development contributes to the Borough's housing stock and regeneration of this part of the borough; and to ensure satisfactory living conditions for residents in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5, H4 and H28 and deposit policies 4.1, 5.2 and 5.5. | Total B1 floorspace shall not be less than 5,500 sqm; ultimately the ability to achieve this level of provision will be determined at the reserved matters stage.  REASON: To ensure a satisfactory form and scale of development in accordance with adopted UDP policies E7 and deposit policy 6.1 and 6.2. | The total retail trading floorspace shall not be less than the existing, but overall retail floorspace shall not exceed 1,424 sq m and shall not be divided into smaller units; this shall form part of the reserved matters required by Condition 2.  REASON: To ensure that the retail provision is of an appropriate form and scale; and not prejudicial to adopted and deposit shopping policies in accordance with adopted UDP policies S8 and deposit policy 7.2. | The B1 units and related car parking and servicing areas hereby approved shall not operate outside the hours of 07.00 to 20.00 hours Monday to Saturday and not at any time on Sundays or Bank or Public Holidays.  REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby residential properties in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5 and B8 and deposit policies 4.11 and 5.5. | Details shall be submitted prior to first installation to demonstrate that any machinery audible outside the premises will be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding: NR35 Leq,5mins, for plant which will operate during the period of 2300 - 0700 hrs weekdays and anytime on Saturdays, Sundays and Bank Holidays. NR40 Leq,1hr for plant which is controlled by time switches only to run during the period 0700-2300hrs Mondays to Fridays, Measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest facade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises with all machines running together.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first use and retained as first implemented thereafter in accord with manufacturers' specifications.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with adopted UDP policies B8 and ES5 and deposit policy 4.11. | The total number of car parking spaces across the development hereby approved shall not exceed 62 spaces.   REASON: To accord with national and local policies to restrain the use of the car in favour of other more environmentally friendly modes of transport in accordance with deposit policy 9.8. | The existing accesses to the site shall be permanently closed before any part of the development permitted is first occupied or brought into use.   REASON: In the interests of highway safety in accordance with adopted UDP policies T63 and deposit policy 9.9. | The developer shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured by Design'.  REASON: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements as detailed by the Government Circular 5/94 'Planning Out Crime' and with requirements of clause 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1988 which imposes a duty on a Local Authority 'to do all that it can to prevent crime and disorder in its area' in accordance with adopted UDP policy B20 and deposit policy 4.1. | Before any works commence on the site, details of a pedestrian access scheme within the site, in  accordance with standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with approved details and thereafter permanently retained.    REASON: To provide adequate facilities for pedestrians and in the interests of sustainable  Development in accordance with adopted UDP policies T12 and deposit policy 9.9. | No development shall take place until full details of sustainable development measures including  Details of:- (i) proposed domestic waste and water recycling, (ii) proposed electric cars and any  other measures aimed at reducing the need to travel, (iii) promotion of use of alternative fuels by  commercial occupants who are vehicle operators, (iv) provisions to enhance the indoor quality of  commercial and residential buildings, such as appropriate design of heating/ventilation/filtration  systems to ensure that the impact of poor external air quality is minimised and all-electric  dwellings, (v) composting, (vi) lighting and the use of natural energy and (vii) full use of  landscaping to provide a buffer between the roads and dwellings have been submitted to and  approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such proposals are to be implemented in accordance with the details so approved and will be subject to review every three years thereafter.   REASON: In the interests of sustainability and air quality, in accordance with adopted UDP policies R17 and deposit policies 2.9 and 2.10. | No external plant or machinery shall be permitted except in accordance with approval of such details by the Local Planning Authority through the submission of a planning application.   REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance  With adopted UDP policies B1, B5 and B8 and deposit policy 4.11 and 5.5. | Prior to commencement of the development details shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority in respect of disabled access within and into the buildings shown in this application; such details shall include details of:-   (i) Level access or gently sloped ramps to be provided at all ingress and egress points within the development;   (ii) all parking and servicing areas   (iii) internal manoeuvring space in all principal rooms, bathrooms and toilets and the width of door openings an 1st and 2nd floors in Swainson Road (Block B) should include appropriate aiding devices for people with disabilities;  (iv) the design, layout and material of all amenity and landscaped areas;  (v) Details of how disabled toilets can be provided in all Class B1 units.  (vi) Details of how fully accessible changing and showering facilities can be provided for occupiers of the proposed Class B1 units.   (vii) Lifts should include appropriate devices for people with sensory impairments.   shall be carried out prior to first occupation of any dwellings and thereafter permanently retained as approved. This condition shall apply notwithstanding the information contained in the application.  REASON: To provide appropriate accessibility for people with disabilities in accordance with adopted UDP policies B1, B6, ES3 and deposit policies 4.3 and 5.3. | No use of each live/work unit for purely residential use shall be carried out without the prior  permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning  application.    REASON: To maintain an appropriate mix of uses on the site in accordance with adopted UDP  policy E7 and deposit policy 4.3, 6.1 and 6.2. | The height of the Block A hereby approved shall not exceed 24.8m to the ridge and 21m tall to the eaves.   REASON: To ensure a satisfactory form and scale of development in accordance with adopted UDP policies B1 and B5 and deposit policies 4.1 and 5.5. | The height of the proposed roof extension hereby approved at Block B shall not exceed 14.4m.   REASON: To ensure a satisfactory form and scale of development in accordance with adopted UDP policies in accordance with adopted UDP policies B1 and B5 and deposit policies 4.1 and 5.5. | Deliveries to the retail store shall not take place outside the hours of 0600 to 2200 Monday to Saturdays and outside the hours of 0900 to 1900 on Sundays, Bank and other Public Holidays.   REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5 and B8 and deposit policies 5.5 and 4.11. | The retail store permitted shall not operate outside 0700 to 2200 hours on any day.   REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5 and B8 and deposit policies 5.5 and 4.11. | The use of the car park for the retail store shall not operate outside the hours of 2200 to 0800 on any day of the week.   REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring properties accordance with adopted UDP policies B5 and B8 and deposit policies 5.5 and 4.11. | The B1 units shall be used for purposes within Class B1 and for no other purpose including warehousing within Class B8 and/or general industrial within Class B2 of the Schedule to the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987 without the prior written permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.   REASON: To restrict the use of the premises to one compatible with the surrounding area, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to maintain strict control over the nature of the use, in the interests of the living conditions of occupiers in the locality. | The Class B1 units, as approved shall not be amalgamated into larger units other than as shown on approved Drawing Nos.0138 (PL) 08E, 10C, 12B.  REASON: In the interests of living conditions of nearby occupiers and so as not to conflict with major office location policies. | The car parking spaces on the approved site plan 0138 (PL) 08E received 20.3.02 shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available for car parking and shall not be used for any other purpose.   REASON: To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site. | The Green Travel Plan hereby approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation and shall continue to operate thereafter. The Green Travel Plan will be reviewed in accordance with LBE guidelines on Green Travel Plans.  REASON: In the interests of sustainability in accordance with adopted UDP policy T40 and deposit policy 9.8. | Prior to the commencement of any development full details of pedestrian visibility splays at locations where pedestrians and vehicle movements conflict shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Such details as approved shall be brought into use before the development hereby approved is first occupied, and retained thereafter.   REASON: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with adopted UDP policy T63 and deposit policy 9.9. | The details of the rear elevation of Morris House, Swainson Road required under Condition 6(i) shall show the lower sections of all existing and new windows and glazing to the proposed new roof extension at Morris House, Swanson Road shall contain only obscure glass and the lower sections of these windows to be also permanently fixed shut.  A sample of the obscured glass, no smaller than 300mm square shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any work is commenced on the relevant part of the development, and the development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the sample thus approved, and retained as installed permanently.   REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5 and H33 and deposit policies 4.1 and 5.5. | Details of a scheme to protect, record and preserve the statue in its place at the top of the front elevation of Morris House shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of any works.  Such details as approved shall be implemented, and the statue retained permanently thereafter.  Reason: To protect a distinctive feature of Morris House in accordance with adopted UDP policy B23 and replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 4.7. | Details of screening treatment to any balconies proposed and agreed within the reserved matters shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing prior to commencement of any works.  Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any part of the premises and retained permanently thereafter.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby residential occupiers in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5 and H33 and replacement UDP policy 5.5. | No plant, ducting or other machinery shall be installed in the south elevation and roof of Morris House, Swainson Road without the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby residential occupiers in accordance with adopted UDP policies B5 and ES5 and replacement UDP policies 4.11.
site_number: ACTON VALE INDUSTRIAL PARK EAST SIDE OF
